definitions: potjuparisa. - EYE/ondwinga. THE MAN WHO HAS A BLIND EYE, CANNOT SEE/Omundu u nondwinga, ka munu. - PERSON/omupotu (ova-)
korongana. THE PIPE IS BLOCKED, THE WATER DOES NOT COME OUT/Omuryu wa korongana, omeva kaye nokupita.
hinga. THE WIND BLOWS STRONGLY/Ombepo mai hingi nomasa. -/singa(i). THE WIND BLOWS/Ombepo mai singi.
suma. THE WATER BOILS/omeva maye suma. BOIL THE WATER AND MAKE TEA!/Sumisa omeva nu hanga otee! BOIL OUT FAT OR BUTTER/te-tisa.
aveyevari; ALL WORDS IN OVA- CLASS (PEOPLE). BOTH THE CHILDREN/Ovanatje avevevari.
orutavi. BRANCHES ON WHICH TO DRY MEAT/otjihuno (ovi-)
omutima omupenda, otjirumendu. I WORK LIKE A MAN/Me ungura otjorumendu. BECOME -/pendapara. BRAVE PERSON/ombangane (ozo-)
koyoka, teka. THE PEN BROKE/Opena ya koyoka. BREAK/koyora, teya. I BREAK THE PEN/Me koyora opena. BREAK UP (IN SMALL PARTS)/mengura, timbura.

:eta! -/hihiza. I BRING FOOD FOR THE BOSS/Me hihiza ovikurya komuhona. - BACK/kotora. - CLOSER/minuna. BRING DOWN/raura. - INTO/hitisa. BRING THE CATTLE INTO THE KRAAL!/Hitisa ozongombe motjunda! BRING ME!/Mbandjeo! Sin. Mbandje. - UP/kurisa.
hahauka. THE CAR IS BROKEN/Otjihauto tja hahauka.
STRONGLY -/ekuryoma. STRONGLY BUILT CALF/ondana ekuryoma. STRONGLY BUILT PERSON/Omundu ekuryoma.
pya. I BURNT MYSELF AGAINST THE HOT STOVE/Mba pi kezuko epyu.
nyosa. THE SUN IS BURNING ME/Eyuvia mari ndji nyosa.
yaka. THE FIRE BURNT/Omuriro wa yaka.

word: BURN (MARK ON THE ARM AS A DECORATION)
